intro: Sisymbrium tuberosum, commonly known as the tuberous whitlowgrass, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many cruciferous plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Sisymbrium tuberosum is known for its tuberous roots, which are sometimes used in traditional medicine. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils.
